storyInfo: Siege and Delphine lead the abandoned Windermere troops and refugees across the battlefield. Shearer wants them to pick up the pace and catch up with the nomadic fortress, but Siege refuses. Trilby Asher finds them and leaves behind an SOS message.

attributes.text: Do you know what the cruelest thing in the world is?
Neither total darkness, nor endless torment, nor a dark alley filled with murderers.
\nIt is when a gentle hand pulls you out of a nightmare, just as you thought it was over, and all the pain would come to an end.
\nOnly for you to realize that salvation was just a cruel joke, a brief respite before falling further into the darkness.
\nEven greater suffering is gazing upon you, within a stone's throw.
And you are powerless before such mockery.

attributes.content: Delphine, do you want to... join us?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Duke of Windermere's coffin is being transported to the approaching battleships. Some of the refugees have taken it upon themselves to organize a funeral procession, in their gratitude.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: She keeps looking at the place where her mother had fallen, even though any trace of blood is long gone.
It may not be a good idea to invite her now...
\nI'm already starting to regret it.

attributes.content: Can you thank them for me, Vina? I... I want to stay here a while longer.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: What did they say to you?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Nothing, I'll just stay for a little longer and cool my head.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Swordguards boarded the late-arriving escort fleet. Most of them kept silent while the nobles panicked.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: A moment's weakness, when I tried to help that soldier...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Vampire reached out his hand. Whether it was an obvious trap or not... mother was wounded because of it.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Broken formation and fallen soldiers. Swordguards do not defend their duke. Their only goal is to fulfill their mission—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: —But they faced a foe powerful beyond their imagination.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Delphine...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The staff officers think there was too much personal sentiment in this reckless operation. They never supported it.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They must believe... that I'm the reason Mother died.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: 'A hero should not die for the weak.'
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And they're right.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: I gaze at the late-arriving battleships, their standards flying high.
\nFor some reason, I am reminded of Allerdale.

attributes.content: I've cleaned your wounds as best I can, Lady Delphine. This is all I can do with the limited amount of medicine available.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Thank you, doctor.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I must go. The general staff have ordered all troops to report back.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I've left behind some things that belong to you.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: These were the Duke's gifts to you... and you have her sword.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: This may sound impudent, but I hope that you will come back to Irnclad Galavae with us.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Whatever the senior officers say, nothing can change the fact that you are the heir to the title of Duke Windermere.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'll think about it... right now, I just want some quiet.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: How are things?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: They took a bunch of people, but many more remain.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: So, that rough mum really...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Ironic, isn't it? The Duke has trained her officers well.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Even now, the general staff of Windermere continue to plot the next course of action according to the plan.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: What about Delphine?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: It seems like the snobbish officers are planning to abandon her.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I don't know. I'm even worried what they might do to Delphine as the 'heir'.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: Heir.

attributes.content: She... she's not ready.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Duke Windermere was a strong leader. Her Swordguards, her general staff, they all serve the greater good of Victoria alone.
attributes.name: Dagda
Dagda
attributes.content: But she herself...

attributes.name: Dagda
attributes.content: She made an admirable, but reckless decision, for the sake of her daughter.
That decision saved a bunch of lives, though, didnnit?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I'm not criticizing her! I respect her!
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: But it means that Delphine is being abandoned by what her mother, Duke Windermere, built on her own.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: What do we do now?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: They took some of the refugees. Can we really trust them? Do we follow the tails of the nobles in the coming battle?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: They didn't take everyone?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: That's not right. If this one ship could take everyone, there's no reason that so many battleships couldn't—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: What's that movement? I thought the ship's engines were out.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The window!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.text: Dust rises from the escort fleet that has only just rendezvoused with us.
\nThey're sailing away.

attributes.content: Delphine!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: She stands on the deck, where her mother left this world, holding her mother's sword in her arms, as she did before I went below.
\nThe wind sweeps at her short hair. Her solitude makes her look even smaller than she is.

attributes.content: What's going on—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: I grab her shoulder. Only then does she come out of her stupor.
\nI see none of the anger, fear, or sorrow that I expected to see. She's wearing barely any emotion at all.
\nOnly calm, flat disappointment, and a quiet so deep it is painful to see.

attributes.content: They're gone.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: Her voice trembles a little.
\nBut it's still too calm.

attributes.content: There are civilians down below waiting to see the Duke of Windermere's coffin off!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Those bastards didn't mind running innocent people over?!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: What's going on?!
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: That's wasn't part of the orders! Maybe there was a miscommunication...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: We still have a few good IFVs. We need to head back to Irnclad Galavae and get confirmation!
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.text: Pah.
I've never gazed upon the tail of a battleship so intently.
\nHow ridiculous.
The marks that the rain of blood left on our clothes is a lingering reminder of that cruel attack.
Several hours have passed since we left the Duke of Windermere's flagship.
\nBad news keeps coming. We did a head count as we left the ship. The Doctor, Amiya and Ascalon were not there.
\nWe only had time to do a brief search, which came up empty.
All I can do is keep faith in their strength. But for some reason, I think back to Amiya's lean shoulders.
\nSorrow and helplessness are luxuries that this group can no longer afford.

attributes.content: Stop dawdling!
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: I... I really can't go any further...
attributes.name: Norport Refugee

attributes.content: I'll whip you if I have to!
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Get up! Stay with the armor if you want to live!
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: I... I need to catch my breath, sir... I have a condition...
attributes.name: Norport Refugee

attributes.content: No dawdling. This isn't just about your life—
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Hands off, Norport hoodlum. I'm just carrying out my orders.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: They're not trained soldiers. They've been at a forced march for five straight hours. They don't have any strength left.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Then they can lie down and die.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: We're trying to save their lives! Everything can still be salvaged, if we make it back to Irnclad Galavae.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: They need to stop and rest.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I said—
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: It's not just for them. It's for you too, Ensign. I know your condition.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Not many soldiers were left behind, but I know almost all of you are Infected—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Shut up!
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: I'll let that slide... this once.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You're Duke Windermere's man. Do not let your actions defile her memory.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.text: Infection, a curse they fear more than any other.
\nCatch up to the ship that abandoned them. Hide the growing black crystals under the bandage.
Fool yourself.

attributes.content: I'm sorry... It's just, don't say that blasted word!
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: I'm fine... I'm fine!
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: I said to keep a low profile on the barrens and avoid drawing Sarkaz attention.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Sir, I...
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: It's getting dark. The civilians trying to keep up with you need to rest, Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No. We continue the march as planned.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: We can reach Hill 31 by midnight at our current pace.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: We'll reestablish communication with Irnclad Galavae there. Only once we're in touch with the nomadic fortress are we truly safe.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: If we wait until morning, I doubt this group is ready to face the Sarkaz and—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You're the ranking officer and de facto commander here, and the ship's doctor.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You know as well as I do that we're trying to catch a fast battleship with our own feet and a few tanks.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I respect your decision, Lieutenant, but we don't even know why those battleships left.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If they didn't respond to your hails at the time, why do you think the fortress will open its gates to us?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I checked on the group. We have less than three companies of combat-effective soldiers, and nearly a thousand refugees following in tow.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: By the time the march that you had in mind is done, there will be less than twenty percent left.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina, right? Listen—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.text: He avoids my gaze.

attributes.content: I mean twenty percent of your soldiers.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: And none of the refugees.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Sir... (whisper)
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.text: I need not hear what they're saying. I saw what happened.
Someone bled his last in the long, silent wall of people.
\nHe left behind a long trail of blood, mixed in with the mud.
\nThe Lieutenant's silence hardly lasts two breaths.

attributes.content: Slow down a little...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: We'll keep going—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.text: Idiot.
My fist leaves its mark on his face.
\nI heard a crisp sound. I think I dislocated his jaw.

attributes.content: ...Argh...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.text: He quickly puts his jaw back in place. Must have dealt with this sort of thing a lot.

attributes.content: You assaulted a soldier, hooligan.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I could have you executed, according to Victorian Service Law.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Stand up.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You could try to execute me. Or we can keep going.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: The fist is a solution that can only be used once in a while.
Dagda, Morgan, and Indra stand in front of the soldiers on edge.
\nThe civilians surround us silently.
\nIt reminds me of how we used to fight turf wars on the streets.

attributes.content: Stand down! Do NOT open fire!
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: They called you Siege, didn't they? They were telling stories that you're actually highborn or something, and with that accent...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'm a hooligan... leader of the Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Fine, I don't care. Listen, I'm a soldier who has pledged his loyalty to the Duke of Windermere...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: My duty is to fulfill the mission handed down by my commander!
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: I'm waiting for you to wipe the blood from your mouth.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Give up. Your elbow is about to dislocate.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Some... sacrifices are acceptable in order to protect the many.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: And just who are the many?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Have you taken a good look at who you're leading?!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: Frightened soldiers, silent civilians, the Infected, the wounded.
\nThe people standing around us.

attributes.content: I'd had enough.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I want to tell them, those who escaped hell in Norport...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'm still looking out for them. There's still someone who cares about them.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Might makes right. Law of the streets, Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'm telling you now that they're going to make camp here, and they're going to rest. We must reconsider our course of action.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If we're cut off from the main force at Irnclad Galavae, everyone is going to die when we run into the Sarkaz. Every last one—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Enough.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Don't insult the memory of the Duke of Windermere any more, Lieutenant Shearer, if you still think you're part of her army.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: How could you—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.text: Delphine clutches the hilt of her sword.
It surprises me. Even more than it surprises Lieutenant Shearer. He's surprised, and angry.
\nI'm suddenly reminded that he had provided medical aid to everyone on the ship, before Irnclad Galavae abandoned us.

attributes.content: Delphine. Your clothes, and the sword...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: A little big for me, is it?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But I need you all to hear me out.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Is the Lieutenant leaving?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Yes. They formed a small squad and picked the tank in best condition. He can leave at any time.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: That squad will travel light and quick. They can reach the marked location before dawn.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You put those clothes on.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Maybe what they represent still means something to someone.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I've spoken to my troops, Lady Delphine. They will follow your orders until I return.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: For the last time, my lady, you're the heir to Windermere. No matter what happens, you should come with us—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Sorry, but I must stay.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: This was my promise to the people. They need to know that Victoria has not abandoned them.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They need this hope to keep going... we can only trust each other now. We must trust each other.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: If the departure of the escorts was just a misunderstanding or a mutiny by a few, then Irnclad Galavae will welcome us, whether I'm there or not.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And if not...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: The Lieutenant's eyelid twitches. Delphine's words are certainly subversive.

attributes.content: My presence will only make things worse. At least you'll live.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: My lady! It's not my own hide that I'm concerned—
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: They let me go the first time, perhaps out of respect for my mother, perhaps out of a sense of... pity. But they won't give me a second chance.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I trust my comrades, and the officers' loyalty to the Duke.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Please take this locating beacon, Lady Delphine. I promise to bring back good news.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: As for you...
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.text: The man gazes calmly at me. I clench my fist, preparing for a sucker punch.

attributes.content: ...You've got some hard knuckles. Take care of Lady Delphine.
attributes.name: Shearer

attributes.content: Cheers, Lieutenant.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Siege, we checked up on the refugees from Norport.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Perhaps the Duke of Windermere had given orders behind our backs... things were chaotic when we boarded the ship, and we couldn't find the one who executed the order.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Regardless, their screening was impeccable. There is no sign of Infection amongst the refugees in the group.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: But now...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.text: I look in the direction where the Lieutenant departed.
\nOf course.

attributes.content: Many soldiers who fought amidst Sarkaz witchcraft are showing acute Infection symptoms.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: These soldiers got Oripathy fighting the Sarkaz. How could their comrades just abandon them like that?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It's an old military tradition. And not a strictly Victorian one; it's the same in Kazimierz, Ursus, Gaul.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Infected are not allowed in camps. More conscientious commanders might put the Infected in their own unit, and send them on the most dangerous missions.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But for the military, there's far too much uncertainty in the Infected and their uncontrolled Arts.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Some must have resisted.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No one ever succeeded. Looking back on history, the Infected make up a relatively small portion of armies in times of war. Acceptable losses in exchange for stability on the front lines.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's even in the textbooks of the Royal Military Academy.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's just—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: 'The honorable martyrs who died for the glorious foundation.'
Now, now, no need to get violent, ladies.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I'm here to talk.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: First, let me make clear that the death of Her Grace Duke Windermere has nothing to do with the part of Victoria that I serve.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: In fact, I bring my sincerest condolences, Lady Delphine. My own position aside, I believe she glowed brighter than any hero in the Battle of the Four Emperors.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But now, who will fill the gap that her death leaves behind? Who can step up to take her place in the grand strategic theater?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Duke Wellington is an accomplished soldier, but we all know he has no intention of giving his all.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Duke Caster has her hands full coordinating everything. Frankly, the death of Duke Windermere is a big, big problem.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You sure got the news quickly, didn't you?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Well, it's my business to know. You'd be familiar... with our line of work.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: What are you here for?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I suggest you think carefully about the next words coming out of your mouth.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Flowers for the hero, Lady Windermere, and a gift of rations and ammunition.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: In exchange for?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You know full well, Your Royal Highness.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The scrap of metal known as the Sighs of Kings.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: To be honest, I have no use for this sword, personally.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You want to trade, sure.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: My conditions are simple—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Take that damnable Stone of the Sword of yours, and bring it to the front lines, where the storm blows the fiercest, where fire falls the hardest.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You can get lost if your plan is to keep this sword safely in the rear, to prop up a tent for kings and nobles to drink tea beneath.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If you really will bring this thing to the lines, and provide shelter for Victoria's warriors, citizens, and the poor souls who have lost their homes...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If it is a shelter for all, whether the son of a blacksmith or the daughter of a teacher, whether they take pay in the name of Victoria or carry weapons of their own making...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Then, by all means, you can have this piece of metal.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Come to me with the Stone of the Sword, Trilby Asher. I promise that I will never fall behind you on the front lines, not by a single step.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Oh my.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: This is beyond my discretion. I'm just an envoy, after all. Her Grace the Duke of Caster has the final decision.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Then go to your master. Come back to me once you have an answer from my dear aunt.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'll do my best, Your Royal Highness Alexandrina.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But... this is just a promise on a personal level.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: What follows now is off the record. Some personal opinions, not of Trilby Asher, but of Sir Suffolk, Bellingham.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: A new voice is not necessarily a bad thing.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You've taken in Infected soldiers... well, and many more civilians, but the point stands... that's all good and fine. But it's not enough. You need an army. Your own army.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: An army with a place for them.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: I'm surprised. Perhaps it's a Caster trick...
\nBut he is encouraging me to form my own Reunion.

attributes.content: Looks like you really did turn off your sound recorder.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Can't do it for too long. Colleagues start getting suspicious, you know.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: ...My grandmother was executed after getting Infected in the War of the Four Nations.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: When she left, she told me with a laugh that there was less than a three percent chance of getting Oripathy in battle. It was only when I inherited the title and looked through the records in the archives that I learned...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The three percent figure has been in use for centuries.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: It has never changed, even though we're using more Originium machines and more complex Originium Arts in modern warfare.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Perhaps you haven't noticed because all you can see is a small corner of the battlefield. Certainly the dukes haven't noticed, because they have their sights set way too far away. But I have.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The Infection problem in the Victorian Army is serious. Serious on an unprecedented scale.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Everyone exercises restraint in a conflict between 'civilized' nations.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: No one wants their camp to be filled with ticking, living time bombs, or seize a dirty city covered in Originium dust.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But now... our enemy is the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: If you really mean to do this, Siege, then it has the potential to be a good thing for your reputation, for my career... perhaps, even for our country.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Thanks for the concern, but my friends and I know the Infected better than you do. We'll be fine.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Oh, by the way, I have some scrap equipment here that nobody wants or cares about. Leftovers, you know.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You can have them. It's all trash, after all.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Farewell, then.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: How much do you believe him?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I would rather believe that even someone like him could not stay out of this conflict.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: What did he leave behind? A recording and coordinates?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: This sound—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: 'Bzzzz—'
'Need... support... Chetleigh...'
\n'Surrounded... Tempest Platoon...'
'Requesting aid!'
